title: [CRITICAL] Three Autonomy Levels Implementation
body:
## Vision Gap

The VISION.md describes **Three Levels of Autonomy** - NONE are currently implemented.

## Required Implementation

### Level 1: Assistant Mode
- K.I.T. analyzes markets and suggests trades
- Human must approve every action
- Full transparency and control
- Good for learning and building trust

### Level 2: Co-Pilot Mode
- Small actions: autonomous (e.g., trades under $100)
- Large actions: ask for approval
- Configurable thresholds
- Daily summary reports

### Level 3: Full Autopilot
- K.I.T. handles everything autonomously
- Human gets daily/weekly reports
- Emergency alerts only
- THIS IS THE ULTIMATE GOAL

## Technical Design

```typescript
interface AutonomyConfig {
  level: 1 | 2 | 3;
  thresholds?: {
    maxTradeSize: number;
    maxDailyLoss: number;
    maxPositions: number;
  };
  notifications: 'all' | 'important' | 'emergency';
  reportFrequency: 'realtime' | 'daily' | 'weekly';
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] User can select autonomy level
- [ ] Level 1: All actions require approval
- [ ] Level 2: Threshold-based auto-approval
- [ ] Level 3: Full autonomous operation
- [ ] Seamless transition between levels

## Priority: CRITICAL
